q: Nothing will work unless you do.
h:
“Nothing will work unless you do.” —
Maya Angelou

q: Being a good example is the best form of service.
h:
“Being a good example is the best form of service.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: You are not stuck where you are unless you decide to be.
h:
“You are not stuck where you are unless you decide to be. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: We should not look back unless it is to derive useful lessons from past errors.
h:
“We should not look back unless it is to derive useful lessons from past errors.” —
George Washington

q: Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat.
h:
“Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
h:
“The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds.
h:
“Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds.” —
George Eliot

q: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
h:
“If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans. ” —
Woody Allen

q: There is no way to happiness - happiness is the way.
h:
“There is no way to happiness - happiness is the way.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: In the middle of chaos lies opportunity.
h:
“In the middle of chaos lies opportunity. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: I am always doing what I cannot do yet, in order to learn how to do it.
h:
“I am always doing what I cannot do yet, in order to learn how to do it.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
h:
“When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.” —
Lao Tzu

q: By the practice of meditation, you will find that you are carrying within your heart a portable paradise.
h:
“By the practice of meditation, you will find that you are carrying within your heart a portable paradise.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: An inventor is a man who asks Why? of the universe and lets nothing stand between the answer and his mind.
h:
“An inventor is a man who asks Why? of the universe and lets nothing stand between the answer and his mind.” —
Ayn Rand

q: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
h:
“The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: What gets measured gets improved.
h:
“What gets measured gets improved.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Extraordinary results happen only when you give the best you have to become the best you can be at your most important work.
h:
“Extraordinary results happen only when you give the best you have to become the best you can be at your most important work.” —
Gary Keller

q: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers.
h:
“The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: If you only knew the magnificence of the 3, 6, and 9, then you would have a key to the universe.
h:
“If you only knew the magnificence of the 3, 6, and 9, then you would have a key to the universe.” —
Nikola Tesla

q: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions.
h:
“Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions.” —
Mark Twain

q: Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.
h:
“Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Throughout this life, you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.
h:
“Throughout this life, you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.” —
Huang Po

q: Don't try to be young. Just open your mind. Stay interested in stuff.
h:
“Don't try to be young. Just open your mind. Stay interested in stuff.” —
Betty White

q: A man has to learn that he cannot command things but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others but that he can mold and master his own will.
h:
“A man has to learn that he cannot command things but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others but that he can mold and master his own will.” —
James Allen

q: Make improvements, not excuses. Seek respect, not attention.
h:
“Make improvements, not excuses. Seek respect, not attention.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.
h:
“The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Don't let the past steal your present.
h:
“Don't let the past steal your present.” —
Cherralea Morgen

q: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
h:
“The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.” —
Mark Twain

q: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night.
h:
“One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Victims recite problems, leaders provide solutions.
h:
“Victims recite problems, leaders provide solutions.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Any idea, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought.
h:
“Any idea, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
h:
“Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.” —
Alexander Pope

q: You get paid in direct proportion to the difficulty of problems you solve.
h:
“You get paid in direct proportion to the difficulty of problems you solve.” —
Elon Musk

q: Think and wonder, wonder and think.
h:
“Think and wonder, wonder and think.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: People are weird. When we find someone with weirdness that is compatible with ours, we team up and call it love.
h:
“People are weird. When we find someone with weirdness that is compatible with ours, we team up and call it love.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: He who leaves the game wins it.
h:
“He who leaves the game wins it.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: You have the ability, now apply yourself.
h:
“You have the ability, now apply yourself.” —
Benjamin Mays

q: You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.
h:
“You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.
h:
“The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.
h:
“Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed.
h:
“Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed.” —
Denis Waitley

q: You need to be doing fewer things for more effect instead of doing more things with side effects.
h:
“You need to be doing fewer things for more effect instead of doing more things with side effects.” —
Gary Keller

q: A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.
h:
“A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: All problems are illusions of the mind.
h:
“All problems are illusions of the mind.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.
h:
“We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.” —
Sydney Smith

q: Humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.
h:
“Humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.” —
Anne Wilson Schaef

q: The sun shines upon good and bad alike.
h:
“The sun shines upon good and bad alike.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
h:
“Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.” —
John Wooden

q: The only way round is through.
h:
“The only way round is through.” —
Robert Frost

q: Science can flourish only in an atmosphere of free speech.
h:
“Science can flourish only in an atmosphere of free speech. ” —
Albert Einstein
